duties_responsibilities.duty: Perform basic emergency medical/trauma procedures and patient care to patients and families of all ages as directed, in accordance with physician orders, hospital policy, scope and standards of practice.
Work 12-hour shifts in the emergency department, providing acute care and trauma support to patients.
Collaborate with the nursing team and patient care providers to ensure efficient and effective patient care in alignment with hospital policy and standards of practice.
Adhere to physician orders and hospital policy for the management of emergency cases and trauma situations.
Assist in the execution of comprehensive emergency medical procedures to stabilize and manage patients in critical conditions.
Comply with California state requirements for emergency medical technician licensure and certifications.

education_certification.credential: California Emergency Medical Technician License, Advanced License, or Paramedic License
